results.title: Are you ready for sex?
results.creator_credit: Sheri Gillette Espar, Henry Mayer and Mayer Espar Productions
results.brief_description: Through dramatization and student discussions, questions concerning sexual responsibility, inter-personal communication, peer group pressure, sexual maturity, personal values, sexual intercourse, the use of contraceptives and sexual abstinence are examined. The discussion has an American cultural bias. Suitable for Mid-Upper Secondary students.

results.title: What is a word processor? or Tale of two sisters
results.creator_credit: Peter Robinson, Robert Reid, IBM (UK) and Video Arts
results.brief_description: A John Cleese training film which explains the principles and illustrates the nature of word processing. Shows all the aspects of office work which the processor can make quicker or easier, and provides a framework of understanding which dispels the mystery and threat surrounding this technology. Features John Cleese, Alison Steadman, Kay Stonham and Carol Hawkins. Photography by Arthur Wooster, sound by Bruce White, edited by Colin Sherman, narrated by Judi Dench, written by David Nobbs.

results.title: Ming-Oi the magician (Hong Kong)
results.creator_credit: Deepa Mehta, Paul Saltzman, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Sunrise Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
Focuses on a sixteen-year-old Hong Kong girl, a magician’s apprentice. who works hard to perfect the illusions of Chinese magic and juggling.

results.title: Warner in the wild
results.creator_credit: David Gray, Wendy Campbell and Greenway Films
results.brief_description: Follows the band “Dave Warner From the Suburbs” as it tours around the far northwest of Australia, suffering the heat and hardships of such a trip. Incorporates some of Warner’s most popular songs as well as providing comments by Warner as to the content of his lyrics, which portray suburban living and the Australian character, as no other Australian songwriter has done. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Badminton: gripping, footwork, serving
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the principles of correct badminton technique. Shows backhand and forehand grips; placement od feet when serving and playing; and the different types of serves - low short forehand, low short backhand, flick serve and drive serve.

results.title: The Battle of Midway
results.creator_credit: John Ford and United States. Dept. of the Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Why we fight”.
John Ford’s Academy Award winning documentary filmed during the Battle of Midway. Narration combines with visuals of the naval air battle, hospitalization of the injured and burial services in a patriotic tribute to the people from the United States battling the Japanese. Suitable for Tertiary level students.

results.title: The Coast: a question of balance
results.creator_credit: David Hughes, Dept of the Navy and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Filmed on location at Mornington Peninsula, Bellarine Peninsula, Apollo Bay, Torquay, Westernport Bay and Port Melbourne, this film is designed to alert students to the conflict inherent in man’s use of the coastal system, potentially one of the most fragile of environments. Shows the abuse of the sand dune systems through leisure, sport, traffic and the erection of structures, as well as the heavy demands placed by industry and shipping on coastal waters. Stresses that these competing interests will, if left unchecked, ultimately destroy the delicate flora and fauna balance of the coastal system. Music performed by Pink Floyd - “Be careful with that axe, Eugene” Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Koalas and co
results.creator_credit: Louise Jonas, Rob McCubbin and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Non-narrated film which makes use of natural sound to observe some of the Australian animals that live in trees. Koalas, fruit bats, tree frogs and primitive looking lizards are observed in detailed close-ups, highlighting their adaptations to live in trees. Filmed at the Royal Melbourne Zoo, Melbourne Botanic Gardens and Healesville Sanctuary. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Elaine Dale: on mine own
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “TV Eye”.
This film is about the inspiring story of Elaine Dale, born without arms - as a result of a side effect of the drug Thalidomide - and now married with one child. Elaine speaks of her own personal struggle to live an independent life while her parents tell of their battle with the drug company for adequate compensation as well as the difficulties encountered in rearing Elaine.

group_siblings.title: World beaters
group_siblings.creator_credit: Thames Television

results.title: If war should come
results.brief_description: Part of the “History through the newsreel: the 1930s” series which presents extracts from newreels which were shown to the British public during the years 1937 to 1939. Covers Britain’s rearmament plans (1937); Guernica’s collapse in air raids during the Spanish Civil War; Tsingtao falling to the Japanese; the opening of a British Military Base in Singapore; the building of the French Maginot Line; the development of bomb proof shelter; air raid precaution techniques in Australia and England; the development of the Spitfire; the introduction of conscription in April 1939; a civil defence recruiting trailer; and the evacuation of children from Britain’s large cities. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
